checklistItems.description: The foundation, load-bearing walls, beams, columns, and overall structural integrity are always evaluated. Assessors check for cracks, settlement issues, water damage, and signs of structural movement or failure.
checklistItems.required: Structural engineer report, foundation inspection, load-bearing analysis

checklistItems.description: Every assessment includes examination of the roof covering, drainage systems, gutters, downspouts, flashing, and any visible signs of leaks or damage. The expected remaining life of the roofing system is often noted.
checklistItems.required: Roof inspection report, drainage system evaluation, material condition assessment

checklistItems.description: This covers all exterior walls, windows, doors, and any exterior cladding or siding. Assessors look for water infiltration points, damaged seals, cracks, and overall weatherproofing condition.
checklistItems.required: Exterior wall assessment, window/door inspection, weatherproofing evaluation
checklistItems.proposed: Envelope integrity survey, seal condition check

checklistItems.description: Fire detection and suppression systems, emergency exits, egress routes, emergency lighting, exit signage, and stairwell conditions are universal assessment items due to their critical importance for occupant safety.
checklistItems.required: Fire system inspection, egress analysis, emergency lighting test, exit signage audit
checklistItems.proposed: Basic fire system check, exit route verification

checklistItems.description: Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning equipment, including their age, condition, operational status, and maintenance history are standard check items.
checklistItems.required: HVAC system inspection, maintenance records, efficiency testing, air quality assessment
checklistItems.proposed: Visual HVAC inspection, basic operational check

checklistItems.description: The main electrical service, distribution panels, wiring condition (where visible), grounding systems, and any obvious code violations or safety hazards are assessed.
checklistItems.required: Electrical system inspection, panel assessment, grounding verification, code compliance check
checklistItems.proposed: Electrical panel review, basic wiring inspection

checklistItems.description: Water supply, drainage systems, visible piping, water heaters, fixtures, and any signs of leaks or water damage are reviewed.
checklistItems.required: Plumbing system inspection, pressure testing, fixture assessment, leak detection
checklistItems.proposed: Visual plumbing check, fixture operation test

checklistItems.description: Most modern assessments include checks for ADA/accessibility compliance, including ramps, doorway widths, bathroom facilities, and parking provisions.
checklistItems.required: Accessibility audit, ramp measurements, doorway assessments, bathroom compliance check
checklistItems.proposed: Basic accessibility survey, door width measurements

checklistItems.description: Parking areas, walkways, landscaping, drainage, retaining walls, and any site lighting or security features are evaluated.
checklistItems.required: Site survey, drainage assessment, parking evaluation, landscaping review
checklistItems.proposed: Visual site inspection, basic drainage check

checklistItems.description: Assessors typically review available maintenance records, warranty information, previous inspection reports, and any relevant permits or certificates of occupancy.
checklistItems.required: Complete documentation review, permit verification, maintenance record analysis
checklistItems.proposed: Basic document collection, permit status check
